alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 12:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski and west central Rockcastle Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1228 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Science Hill, or 9 miles north of Somerset, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bobtown and Dabney around 1245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Shopville, Woodstock, Bandy, Valley Oak, Willailla, Level Green, Quail, Bee Lick and Ottowa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
